attributes.name: src
attributes.description: URL of the avatar image.

attributes.name: fit
attributes.description:
Image resizing method, similar to the native CSS [`object-fit`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/object-fit). Possible values:

* `contain`: Scales the image to fit within the box while maintaining the aspect ratio. The image will be "letterboxed" if the aspect ratios do not match.
* `cover`: Scales the image to fill the box while maintaining the aspect ratio. The image will be clipped if the aspect ratios do not match.
* `fill`: Default. Scales the image to fill the box. The image will be stretched if the aspect ratios do not match.
* `none`: No resizing.
* `scale-down`: Scales as if `none` or `contain` were specified, choosing the smaller result.

values.description: No resizing.

values.name: scale-down

attributes.description: When set, detaches the [`<mdui-fab>`](https://www.mdui.org/en/docs/2/components/fab) from the bottom app bar. The [`<mdui-fab>`](https://www.mdui.org/en/docs/2/components/fab) remains on the page even after the app bar is hidden.

attributes.name: scroll-behavior
attributes.description:
Defines the scroll behavior. Possible values:

* `hide`: Hides when scrolling.

attributes.name: scroll-target
attributes.description: The element that listens for scroll events. Accepts a CSS selector, DOM element, or [JQ object](https://www.mdui.org/en/docs/2/functions/jq). Defaults to `window`.

attributes.name: scroll-threshold
attributes.description: The scroll distance (in pixels) that triggers the scroll behavior.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the layout order within the [`<mdui-layout>`](https://www.mdui.org/en/docs/2/components/layout) component. Items are sorted in ascending order. The default value is `0`.

Defines the icon button style. Possible values:
* `standard`: For low-priority actions.
* `filled`: Has the strongest visual effect, suitable for high-priority actions.
* `tonal`: A visual effect between `filled` and `outlined`, suitable for medium to high-priority actions.
* `outlined`: For medium-priority actions.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Defines where to open the linked URL. Possible values:

* `_blank`: Opens in a new tab or window.
* `_parent`: Opens in the parent browsing context or `_self` if no parent.
* `_self`: Opens in the current browsing context. (Default).
* `_top`: Opens in the topmost browsing context or `_self` if no ancestors.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is specified.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
Specifies the relationship of the linked URL as space-separated link types. Possible values:

* `alternate`: Alternate versions of the current document.
* `author`: The author of the current document or article.
* `bookmark`: The permalink for the nearest ancestor section.
* `external`: The referenced document is not part of the same site as the current document.
* `help`: A link to context-sensitive help.
* `license`: Indicates that the main content of the current document is covered by the copyright license described by the referenced document.
* `me`: Indicates that the current document represents the person who owns the linked content.
* `next`: Indicates that the current document is part of a series and the next document in the series is the referenced document.
* `nofollow`: Indicates that the current document's original author or publisher does not endorse the referenced document.
* `noreferrer`: No `Referer` header will be included. Also has the same effect as `noopener`.
* `opener`: Creates an auxiliary browsing context if the hyperlink would otherwise create a top-level browsing context that is not an auxiliary browsing context (i.e., has "`_blank`" as `target` attribute value).
* `prev`: Indicates that the current document is part of a series and the previous document in the series is the referenced document.
* `search`: Links to a resource that can be used to search through the current document and its related pages.
* `tag`: Gives a tag (identified by the given address) that applies to the current document.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is specified.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
The button's name, which is submitted with form data.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is not specified.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The button's value, which is submitted with form data.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is not specified.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
Defines the button's default behavior. The default is `button`. Possible values:

* `submit`: Submits the form data to the server.
* `reset`: Resets all the controls to their initial values.
* `button`: No default behavior, does nothing when pressed by default.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is not specified.

values.name: submit
values.description: Submits the form data to the server.

values.name: reset
values.description: Resets all the controls to their initial values.

values.name: button
values.description: No default behavior, does nothing when pressed by default.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description:
Associates the button with a `<form>` element. The value should be the `id` of a `<form>` in the same document. If not set, the button is associated with its parent `<form>`, if any.

This attribute allows button elements to be associated with `<form>`s anywhere in the document, not just inside a `<form>`.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified.

attributes.name: formaction
attributes.description:
Specifies the URL that processes the button's submitted information. Overrides the `action` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

attributes.name: formenctype
attributes.description:
Specifies the form data encoding method. Possible values:

* `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`: Default if the attribute is not used.
* `multipart/form-data`: Used for `<input>` elements with `type` set to `file`.
* `text/plain`: For debugging, not for real form submission.

Overrides the `enctype` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

values.name: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
values.description: Default if the attribute is not used.

values.name: multipart/form-data
values.description: Used for `<input>` elements with `type` set to `file`.

values.name: text/plain
values.description: For debugging, not for real form submission.

attributes.name: formmethod
attributes.description:
Specifies the HTTP method for form submission. Possible values:

* `post`: Form data included in HTTP request body.
* `get`: Form data appended to `action` URL.

Overrides the `method` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

values.name: post
values.description: Form data included in HTTP request body.

values.name: get
values.description: Form data appended to `action` URL.

attributes.name: formnovalidate
attributes.description:
Specifies that the form should not be validated on submission. Overrides the `novalidate` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

attributes.name: formtarget
attributes.description:
Specifies where to display the form submission response. Possible values:

* `_self`: Current browsing context. (Default).
* `_blank`: New tab or window.
* `_parent`: Parent browsing context or `_self` if no parent.
* `_top`: Topmost browsing context or `_self` if no ancestors.

Overrides the `target` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

* `filled`: Used for final actions like 'Save' or 'Confirm'.

* `outlined`: A bordered button for medium-priority and secondary actions.
* `text`: A text button for low-priority actions.

attributes.description:
Defines the chip type. Possible values:

* `assist`: Displays auxiliary actions related to the context, such as sharing and favoriting on a meal ordering page.

* `suggestion`: Provides dynamically generated suggestions to simplify user actions, like message predictions in a chat application.

values.description: Filters content, like search results on a search results page.

values.name: input
values.description: Represents fragments of user input, such as contacts in the 'To' field in Gmail.

values.name: suggestion
values.description: Provides dynamically generated suggestions to simplify user actions, like message predictions in a chat application.

attributes.name: elevated
attributes.description: Gives the chip a shadow.

attributes.name: selectable
attributes.description: Makes the chip selectable.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Marks the chip as selected.

attributes.name: deletable
attributes.description: Makes the chip deletable. When set, a delete icon appears on the right.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: Sets the Material Icons name for the left icon. Alternatively, use `slot="icon"`.

attributes.name: selected-icon
attributes.description: Sets the Material Icons name for the left icon when selected. Alternatively, use `slot="selected-icon"`.

attributes.name: end-icon
attributes.description: Sets the Material Icons name for the right icon. Alternatively, use `slot="end-icon"`.

attributes.name: delete-icon
attributes.description: Sets the Material Icons name for the delete icon when deletable. Alternatively, use `slot="delete-icon"`.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: The URL for the hyperlink. If provided, the component is rendered as an `<a>` element and can use link-related attributes.

attributes.name: download
attributes.description:
Instructs the browser to download the linked URL.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is specified.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Defines where to open the linked URL. Possible values:

* `_blank`: Opens in a new tab or window.
* `_parent`: Opens in the parent browsing context or `_self` if no parent.
* `_self`: Opens in the current browsing context. (Default).
* `_top`: Opens in the topmost browsing context or `_self` if no ancestors.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is specified.

values.description: Opens in a new tab or window.

values.description: Opens in the parent browsing context or `_self` if no parent.

values.name: _self
values.description: Opens in the current browsing context. (Default).

values.name: _top
values.description: Opens in the topmost browsing context or `_self` if no ancestors.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
Specifies the relationship of the linked URL as space-separated link types. Possible values:

* `alternate`: Alternate versions of the current document.
* `author`: The author of the current document or article.
* `bookmark`: The permalink for the nearest ancestor section.
* `external`: The referenced document is not part of the same site as the current document.
* `help`: A link to context-sensitive help.
* `license`: Indicates that the main content of the current document is covered by the copyright license described by the referenced document.
* `me`: Indicates that the current document represents the person who owns the linked content.
* `next`: Indicates that the current document is part of a series and the next document in the series is the referenced document.
* `nofollow`: Indicates that the current document's original author or publisher does not endorse the referenced document.
* `noreferrer`: No `Referer` header will be included. Also has the same effect as `noopener`.
* `opener`: Creates an auxiliary browsing context if the hyperlink would otherwise create a top-level browsing context that is not an auxiliary browsing context (i.e., has "`_blank`" as `target` attribute value).
* `prev`: Indicates that the current document is part of a series and the previous document in the series is the referenced document.
* `search`: Links to a resource that can be used to search through the current document and its related pages.
* `tag`: Gives a tag (identified by the given address) that applies to the current document.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is specified.

attributes.description: Specifies that the element should be focused when the page loads.

attributes.name: tabindex
attributes.description: Defines the order in which the element receives focus when navigating with the Tab key.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the element.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Indicates that the element is in a loading state.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
The button's name, which is submitted with form data.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is not specified.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The button's value, which is submitted with form data.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is not specified.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
Defines the button's default behavior. The default is `button`. Possible values:

* `submit`: Submits the form data to the server.
* `reset`: Resets all the controls to their initial values.
* `button`: No default behavior, does nothing when pressed by default.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is not specified.

values.name: submit
values.description: Submits the form data to the server.

values.name: reset
values.description: Resets all the controls to their initial values.

values.name: button
values.description: No default behavior, does nothing when pressed by default.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description:
Associates the button with a `<form>` element. The value should be the `id` of a `<form>` in the same document. If not set, the button is associated with its parent `<form>`, if any.

This attribute allows button elements to be associated with `<form>`s anywhere in the document, not just inside a `<form>`.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified.

attributes.name: formaction
attributes.description:
Specifies the URL that processes the button's submitted information. Overrides the `action` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

attributes.name: formenctype
attributes.description:
Specifies the form data encoding method. Possible values:

* `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`: Default if the attribute is not used.
* `multipart/form-data`: Used for `<input>` elements with `type` set to `file`.
* `text/plain`: For debugging, not for real form submission.

Overrides the `enctype` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

values.name: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
values.description: Default if the attribute is not used.

values.name: multipart/form-data
values.description: Used for `<input>` elements with `type` set to `file`.

values.name: text/plain
values.description: For debugging, not for real form submission.

attributes.name: formmethod
attributes.description:
Specifies the HTTP method for form submission. Possible values:

* `post`: Form data included in HTTP request body.
* `get`: Form data appended to `action` URL.

Overrides the `method` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

values.name: post
values.description: Form data included in HTTP request body.

values.name: get
values.description: Form data appended to `action` URL.

attributes.name: formnovalidate
attributes.description:
Specifies that the form should not be validated on submission. Overrides the `novalidate` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

attributes.name: formtarget
attributes.description:
Specifies where to display the form submission response. Possible values:

* `_self`: Current browsing context. (Default).
* `_blank`: New tab or window.
* `_parent`: Parent browsing context or `_self` if no parent.
* `_top`: Topmost browsing context or `_self` if no ancestors.

Overrides the `target` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

tags.name: mdui-collapse-item
tags.description:
Collapse Item Component  It should be used in conjunction with the `<mdui-collapse>` component 

```html
<mdui-collapse>
  <mdui-collapse-item header="header-1">content-1</mdui-collapse-item>
  <mdui-collapse-item header="header-2">content-2</mdui-collapse-item>
</mdui-collapse>
```

attributes.description: Specifies the value of the collapsible panel item.

attributes.name: header
attributes.description: Sets the header text for the collapsible panel item.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the collapsible panel item.

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description: Identifies the element that triggers the collapse on click. This can be a CSS selector, a DOM element, or a [JQ object](https://www.mdui.org/en/docs/2/functions/jq). By default, the entire header area is the trigger.

tags.name: mdui-collapse

attributes.description: Activates accordion mode.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
Specifies the open `<mdui-collapse-item>` value.

Note: The HTML attribute is always a string and can only be initially set when `accordion` is `true`. The JavaScript property value is a string when `accordion` is `true` and a string array when `accordion` is `false`. To modify this value when `accordion` is `false`, you must change the JavaScript property.

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description:
Defines the trigger method for the dropdown. Supports multiple space-separated values. Possible values:

* `click`: Trigger on click.
* `hover`: Trigger on mouse hover.
* `focus`: Trigger on focus.
* `contextmenu`: Trigger on right-click or touch long press.
* `manual`: If used, the dropdown can only be opened and closed programmatically, and no other trigger methods can be specified.

Sets the position of the dropdown. Possible values:

* `auto`: Automatically determine the position.
* `top-start`: Above and left-aligned.

* `bottom-start`: Below and left-aligned.
* `bottom`: Below and centered.

* `left-start`: Left and top-aligned.

* `left-end`: Left and bottom-aligned.
* `right-start`: Right and top-aligned.
* `right`: Right and centered.
* `right-end`: Right and bottom-aligned.

Elements like [`<mdui-checkbox>`](https://www.mdui.org/en/docs/2/components/checkbox), [`<mdui-radio>`](https://www.mdui.org/en/docs/2/components/radio), [`<mdui-switch>`](https://www.mdui.org/en/docs/2/components/switch) remain interactive.

attributes.name: rounded
attributes.description: Applies rounded style to the list item.

attributes.name: alignment
attributes.description:
Vertical alignment of the list item. Possible values:

* `start`: Top alignment.
* `center`: Center alignment.
* `end`: Bottom alignment.

values.name: start
values.description: Top alignment.

values.name: center
values.description: Center alignment.

values.name: end
values.description: Bottom alignment.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: The URL for the hyperlink. If specified, the component renders as an `<a>` element and can use link-related attributes.

attributes.name: download
attributes.description:
Instructs the browser to treat the linked URL as a download.

**Note**:  This is only available when `href` is specified.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Defines where to display the linked URL. Possible values:

* `_blank`: Opens in a new tab or window.
* `_parent`: Opens in the parent browsing context or `_self` if no parent exists.
* `_self`: Opens in the current browsing context. (Default).
* `_top`: Opens in the topmost browsing context or `_self` if no ancestors exist.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is specified.

values.name: _blank
values.description: Opens in a new tab or window.

values.name: _parent
values.description: Opens in the parent browsing context or `_self` if no parent exists.

values.name: _self
values.description: Opens in the current browsing context. (Default).

values.name: _top
values.description: Opens in the topmost browsing context or `_self` if no ancestors exist.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
Specifies the relationship of the linked URL as space-separated link types. Possible values:

* `alternate`: Alternate versions of the current document.
* `author`: Author of the current document or article.
* `bookmark`: Permanent link for the nearest ancestor section.
* `external`: The referenced document is not part of the same site as the current document.
* `help`: Link to context-sensitive help.
* `license`: Indicates that the main content of the current document is covered by the copyright license described by the referenced document.
* `me`: Indicates that the current document represents the person who owns the linked content.
* `next`: Indicates that the current document is part of a series and the next document in the series is the referenced document.
* `nofollow`: Indicates that the current document's original author or publisher does not endorse the referenced document.
* `noreferrer`: No `Referer` header will be included. Also has the same effect as `noopener`.
* `opener`: Creates an auxiliary browsing context if the hyperlink would otherwise create a top-level browsing context that is not an auxiliary browsing context (i.e., has "`_blank`" as `target` attribute value).
* `prev`: Indicates that the current document is part of a series and the previous document in the series is the referenced document.
* `search`: Links to a resource that can be used to search through the current document and its related pages.
* `tag`: Gives a tag (identified by the given address) that applies to the current document.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is specified.

tags.name: mdui-list-subheader

```html
<mdui-list>

</mdui-list>
```

tags.name: mdui-menu
tags.description:
Menu Component  It should be used in conjunction with the `<mdui-menu-item>` component 

```html
<mdui-menu>
  <mdui-menu-item>Item 1</mdui-menu-item>
  <mdui-menu-item>Item 2</mdui-menu-item>
</mdui-menu>
```

attributes.name: selects
attributes.description:
Defines the selectable state of menu items. Defaults to non-selectable. Possible values:

* `single`: Only one item can be selected at a time.
* `multiple`: Multiple items can be selected.

values.name: single
values.description: Only one item can be selected at a time.

values.name: multiple
values.description: Multiple items can be selected.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The value of the selected `<mdui-menu-item>`.

Note: The HTML attribute is always a string and can only be set as an initial value when `selects="single"`. The JavaScript property value is a string when `selects="single"` and an array of strings when `selects="multiple"`. In `selects="multiple"`, this value can only be modified by changing the JavaScript property.

attributes.name: dense
attributes.description: Indicates whether the menu items use a compact layout.

attributes.name: submenu-trigger
attributes.description:
Defines the trigger method for submenus. Supports multiple values separated by spaces. Possible values:

* `click`: Open submenu when clicking on a menu item.
* `hover`: Open submenu when hovering over a menu item.
* `focus`: Open submenu when focusing on a menu item.
* `manual`: Only programmatically open and close submenus, no other trigger methods can be specified.

values.name: click
values.description: Open submenu when clicking on a menu item.

values.name: hover
values.description: Open submenu when hovering over a menu item.

values.name: focus
values.description: Open submenu when focusing on a menu item.

values.name: manual
values.description: Only programmatically open and close submenus, no other trigger methods can be specified.

attributes.name: submenu-open-delay
attributes.description: Specifies the delay (in milliseconds) for opening a submenu via hover.

attributes.name: submenu-close-delay
attributes.description: Specifies the delay (in milliseconds) for closing a submenu via hover.

tags.description:
Navigation Bar Component  It should be used in conjunction with the `<mdui-navigation-bar-item>` component 

```html
<mdui-navigation-bar>
  <mdui-navigation-bar-item icon="place">Item 1</mdui-navigation-bar-item>
  <mdui-navigation-bar-item icon="commute">Item 2</mdui-navigation-bar-item>
  <mdui-navigation-bar-item icon="people">Item 3</mdui-navigation-bar-item>
</mdui-navigation-bar>
```

attributes.name: hide
attributes.description: Hides the navigation bar when set.

attributes.name: label-visibility
attributes.description:
Specifies the visibility of the text. Possible values:

* `auto`: Visible if there are 3 or fewer options, otherwise only the selected state is visible.
* `selected`: Only visible in the selected state.
* `labeled`: Always visible.
* `unlabeled`: Never visible.

values.name: auto
values.description: Visible if there are 3 or fewer options, otherwise only the selected state is visible.

values.name: selected
values.description: Only visible in the selected state.

values.name: labeled
values.description: Always visible.

values.name: unlabeled
values.description: Never visible.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the selected `<mdui-navigation-bar-item>`.

attributes.name: scroll-behavior
attributes.description:
Defines the scroll behavior. Possible values:

* `hide`: Hides when scrolling.

attributes.name: scroll-target
attributes.description: The element that listens for scroll events. Accepts a CSS selector, DOM element, or [JQ object](https://www.mdui.org/en/docs/2/functions/jq). Defaults to `window`.

attributes.name: scroll-threshold
attributes.description: The scroll distance (in pixels) that triggers the scroll behavior.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the layout order within the [`<mdui-layout>`](https://www.mdui.org/en/docs/2/components/layout) component. Items are sorted in ascending order. The default value is `0`.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Opens the navigation drawer.

attributes.name: modal
attributes.description:
Displays an overlay when open.

On narrow devices (screen width < [`--mdui-breakpoint-md`](https://www.mdui.org/en/docs/2/styles/design-tokens#breakpoint)), the overlay always displays.

attributes.name: close-on-esc
attributes.description: Closes the drawer when the ESC key is pressed and an overlay is present.

attributes.name: close-on-overlay-click
attributes.description: Closes the drawer when the overlay is clicked.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
Sets the drawer's display position. Possible values:

* `left`: Display on the left side.
* `right`: Display on the right side.

values.name: left
values.description: Display on the left side.

values.name: right
values.description: Display on the right side.

attributes.name: contained
attributes.description:
By default, the navigation drawer displays relative to the `body` element. When set, it displays relative to its parent element.

Note: You must add `position: relative; overflow: hidden;` style to the parent element when this attribute is set.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the layout order within the [`<mdui-layout>`](https://www.mdui.org/en/docs/2/components/layout) component. Items are sorted in ascending order. The default value is `0`.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: The URL for the hyperlink. If provided, the component is rendered as an `<a>` element and can use link-related attributes.

attributes.name: download
attributes.description:
Instructs the browser to download the linked URL.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is specified.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Defines where to open the linked URL. Possible values:

* `_blank`: Opens in a new tab or window.
* `_parent`: Opens in the parent browsing context or `_self` if no parent.
* `_self`: Opens in the current browsing context. (Default).
* `_top`: Opens in the topmost browsing context or `_self` if no ancestors.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is specified.

values.name: _blank
values.description: Opens in a new tab or window.

values.name: _parent
values.description: Opens in the parent browsing context or `_self` if no parent.

values.name: _self
values.description: Opens in the current browsing context. (Default).

values.name: _top
values.description: Opens in the topmost browsing context or `_self` if no ancestors.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
Specifies the relationship of the linked URL as space-separated link types. Possible values:

* `alternate`: Alternate versions of the current document.
* `author`: The author of the current document or article.
* `bookmark`: The permalink for the nearest ancestor section.
* `external`: The referenced document is not part of the same site as the current document.
* `help`: A link to context-sensitive help.
* `license`: Indicates that the main content of the current document is covered by the copyright license described by the referenced document.
* `me`: Indicates that the current document represents the person who owns the linked content.
* `next`: Indicates that the current document is part of a series and the next document in the series is the referenced document.
* `nofollow`: Indicates that the current document's original author or publisher does not endorse the referenced document.
* `noreferrer`: No `Referer` header will be included. Also has the same effect as `noopener`.
* `opener`: Creates an auxiliary browsing context if the hyperlink would otherwise create a top-level browsing context that is not an auxiliary browsing context (i.e., has "`_blank`" as `target` attribute value).
* `prev`: Indicates that the current document is part of a series and the previous document in the series is the referenced document.
* `search`: Links to a resource that can be used to search through the current document and its related pages.
* `tag`: Gives a tag (identified by the given address) that applies to the current document.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is specified.

attributes.description:

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The button's value, which is submitted with form data.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is not specified.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
Defines the button's default behavior. The default is `button`. Possible values:

* `submit`: Submits the form data to the server.
* `reset`: Resets all the controls to their initial values.
* `button`: No default behavior, does nothing when pressed by default.

**Note**: This is only available when `href` is not specified.

values.name: submit
values.description: Submits the form data to the server.

values.name: reset
values.description: Resets all the controls to their initial values.

values.name: button
values.description: No default behavior, does nothing when pressed by default.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description:
Associates the button with a `<form>` element. The value should be the `id` of a `<form>` in the same document. If not set, the button is associated with its parent `<form>`, if any.

This attribute allows button elements to be associated with `<form>`s anywhere in the document, not just inside a `<form>`.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified.

attributes.name: formaction
attributes.description:
Specifies the URL that processes the button's submitted information. Overrides the `action` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

attributes.name: formenctype
attributes.description:
Specifies the form data encoding method. Possible values:

* `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`: Default if the attribute is not used.
* `multipart/form-data`: Used for `<input>` elements with `type` set to `file`.
* `text/plain`: For debugging, not for real form submission.

Overrides the `enctype` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

values.name: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
values.description: Default if the attribute is not used.

values.name: multipart/form-data
values.description: Used for `<input>` elements with `type` set to `file`.

values.name: text/plain
values.description: For debugging, not for real form submission.

attributes.name: formmethod
attributes.description:
Specifies the HTTP method for form submission. Possible values:

* `post`: Form data included in HTTP request body.
* `get`: Form data appended to `action` URL.

Overrides the `method` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

values.name: post
values.description: Form data included in HTTP request body.

values.name: get
values.description: Form data appended to `action` URL.

attributes.name: formnovalidate
attributes.description:
Specifies that the form should not be validated on submission. Overrides the `novalidate` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

attributes.name: formtarget
attributes.description:
Specifies where to display the form submission response. Possible values:

* `_self`: Current browsing context. (Default).
* `_blank`: New tab or window.
* `_parent`: Parent browsing context or `_self` if no parent.
* `_top`: Topmost browsing context or `_self` if no ancestors.

Overrides the `target` attribute of the button's form owner.

**Note**: Only available when `href` is not specified and `type="submit"`.

values.name: _self
values.description: Current browsing context. (Default).

values.description: New tab or window.

values.name: _parent
values.description: Parent browsing context or `_self` if no parent.

values.name: _top
values.description: Topmost browsing context or `_self` if no ancestors.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
Specifies the text field type. Default is `text`. Possible values:

* `text`: Standard text field.
* `number`: Allows only numeric input. Devices with dynamic keyboards will display a numeric keyboard.
* `password`: Masks the input for password confidentiality.
* `url`: Validates URL format. Devices with dynamic keyboards will display a URL-specific keyboard.
* `email`: Validates email format. Devices with dynamic keyboards will display an email-specific keyboard.
* `search`: Changes the enter icon to a search icon on devices with dynamic keyboards.
* `tel`: Displays a phone number keyboard on devices with dynamic keyboards.
* `hidden`: Hides the control, but its value will still be submitted to the server.
* `date`: Activates a date picker or a numeric scroll wheel for year, month, and day in supported browsers.
* `datetime-local`: Activates a date and time picker in supported browsers, excluding time zone.
* `month`: Allows input for year and month, excluding time zone.
* `time`: Allows time input, excluding time zone.
* `week`: Allows input for dates consisting of a year and week, excluding time zone.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of text field, which is submitted with form data.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of text field, which is submitted with form data.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Label text.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Placeholder text.

attributes.name: helper
attributes.description: The helper text displayed at the bottom of the text field. Alternatively, use `slot="helper"`.

attributes.name: helper-on-focus
attributes.description: If set, the helper text is only displayed when the text field is focused.

attributes.name: clearable
attributes.description: If set, the text field can be cleared.

attributes.name: clear-icon
attributes.description: Material Icons name displayed on the right when the text field is clearable. Alternatively, use `slot="clear-icon"`.

attributes.name: end-aligned
attributes.description: Aligns the text to the right.

attributes.name: prefix
attributes.description: The prefix text for the text field. It is only displayed when the text field is focused or has a value. Alternatively, use `slot="prefix"`.

attributes.name: suffix
attributes.description: The suffix text for the text field. It is only displayed when the text field is focused or has a value. Alternatively, use `slot="suffix"`.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: Material Icons name for the prefix icon of the text field. Alternatively, use `slot="icon"`.

attributes.name: end-icon
attributes.description: Material Icons name for the suffix icon of the text field. Alternatively, use `slot="end-icon"`.

attributes.name: error-icon
attributes.description: Material Icons name displayed on the right side of the text field when the form field validation fails. Alternatively, use `slot="error-icon"`.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description:
Associates the text field with a `<form>` element. The value should be the `id` of a `<form>` in the same document. If not set, the text field is associated with its parent `<form>`, if any.

This attribute allows text field elements to be associated with `<form>`s anywhere in the document, not just inside a `<form>`.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Makes the text field read-only.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Disables the text field.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: The field must be filled in before the form is submitted.

attributes.name: rows
attributes.description: The number of rows in the text field.

attributes.name: autosize
attributes.description: Allows the text field height to adjust automatically based on the input content.

attributes.name: min-rows
attributes.description: The minimum number of rows when `autosize` is enabled.

attributes.name: max-rows
attributes.description: The maximum number of rows when `autosize` is enabled.

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: The minimum number of characters for input.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: The maximum number of characters for input.

attributes.name: counter
attributes.description: Displays the character count when `maxlength` is specified.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The minimum value when `type` is `number`.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The maximum value when `type` is `number`.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: The step interval during increment and decrement when `type` is `number`.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: The regular expression for form validation.

attributes.name: toggle-password
attributes.description: Adds a toggle button for showing and hiding the password when `type` is `password`.

attributes.name: show-password-icon
attributes.description: Material Icons name for the visible password toggle button. Alternatively, use `slot="show-password-icon"`.

attributes.name: hide-password-icon
attributes.description: Material Icons name for the hidden password toggle button. Alternatively, use `slot="hide-password-icon"`.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description:
A non-standard iOS attribute for automatic capitalization. Possible values:

* `none`: Disables automatic capitalization.
* `sentences`: Capitalizes the first letter of each sentence.
* `words`: Capitalizes the first letter of each word.
* `characters`: Capitalizes all letters.

values.description: Capitalizes the first letter of each sentence.

values.name: words

values.name: characters
values.description: Capitalizes all letters.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description:
Enables the browser's autocomplete feature for text input. Possible values:

* `off`: Disables browser autocomplete.
* `on`: Enables browser autocomplete.

values.name: off
values.description: Disables browser autocomplete.

values.name: on
values.description: Enables browser autocomplete.

attributes.name: enterkeyhint
attributes.description:
Customizes the Enter key text or icon on the virtual keyboard. The effect varies based on the device and language. Possible values:

* `enter`: Inserts a new line, typically used in a multi-line text field.
* `done`: Indicates input completion, closes the virtual keyboard.
* `go`: Navigates to the target of the entered text.
* `next`: Moves to the next text field.
* `previous`: Moves to the previous text field.
* `search`: Navigates to search results.
* `send`: Sends a text message.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description:
Customizes the virtual keyboard. Possible values:

* `none`: No virtual keyboard. This is useful for custom input controls.
* `text`: Standard text input keyboard.
* `decimal`: Decimal input keyboard. This includes a period `.` or comma `,` and numbers.
* `numeric`: Numeric keyboard. This displays numbers 0-9.
* `tel`: Phone number keyboard. This includes numbers 0-9, asterisk `*`, and hash `#` keys.
* `search`: Search-optimized virtual keyboard. 'Search' is displayed on the submit button.
* `email`: Email-optimized virtual keyboard. This typically includes `@ .`.
* `url`: URL-optimized virtual keyboard. This typically includes `. / #`.

attributes.name: variant
attributes.description:
Defines the top app bar style. Default is `small`. Possible values:

* `center-aligned`: Small app bar with a center-aligned title.
* `small`: Small app bar.
* `medium`: Medium-sized app bar.
* `large`: Large-sized app bar.

values.description: Large-sized app bar.

attributes.name: hide
attributes.description: Hide the top app bar.

attributes.name: shrink
attributes.description: Shrinks the app bar to `small` style. Only applicable for `medium` or `large` variants.

attributes.name: scroll-behavior
attributes.description:
Defines the scroll behavior. Accepts multiple space-separated values. Possible values:

* `hide`: Hides when scrolling.
* `shrink`: Shrinks when scrolling for medium to large app bars.
* `elevate`: Increases elevation when scrolling.

attributes.name: scroll-target
attributes.description: The element that listens for scroll events. Accepts a CSS selector, DOM element, or [JQ object](https://www.mdui.org/en/docs/2/functions/jq). Defaults to `window`.

attributes.name: scroll-threshold
attributes.description: The scroll distance (in pixels) that triggers the scroll behavior.

attributes.name: order
attributes.description: Specifies the layout order within the [`<mdui-layout>`](https://www.mdui.org/en/docs/2/components/layout) component. Items are sorted in ascending order. The default value is `0`.
